content.match_overview: Liverpool host West Ham United at Anfield in a Premier League clash where the Reds aim to reassert their title credentials after a recent dip in form[2]. Despite a 3-2 defeat at Fulham, Liverpool remain 11 points clear at the summit with seven games remaining[1]. West Ham sit 15th with patchy away form (4 wins in 15 road games) but have shown resilience under Graham Potter, drawing at Everton and Aston Villa[1][3]. Historically dominant, Liverpool have won nine consecutive H2H meetings, including a 5-1 EFL Cup victory this season[5].

prediction.reasoning: Liverpool's xG dominance (3.30 vs 1.25)[4] and West Ham's defensive vulnerabilities (1.68 GA/away)[3] align with historical routs. Fatigue concerns offset by Alisson's return and Anfield factor[1][6].

my_say.content: As Anfield prepares to host its first match since the seismic announcements of Salah and Van Dijk's contract extensions, there's a palpable sense of a dynasty reaffirming itself. Yet whisper it quietly - this Liverpool machine isn't quite purring. The 11% drop in runs into the box[2] speaks to weary legs, while West Ham's loanee Wan-Bissaka brings Champions League pedigree to their backline. But in the cold calculus of xG and H2H dominance, this remains a mismatch. Watch for Slot's men to channel the energy of 54,000 euphoric fans into a statement victory - the kind that doesn't just secure three points, but silences nascent doubts about their staying power. When the Kop belts out 'You'll Never Walk Alone' on Sunday, they'll be serenading not just a team, but a juggernaut rediscovering its rhythm.
